divs: sighting detailswe were clearing snow off of our cars after a recent storm at approximately 8:15pm on 1-14-08. we looked up and over the western sky and saw a series of rather bright lights flashing and illuminating the upper portion of the sky (at cloud level and up). they really looked like an aurora, except the lights changed rather quickly (every second) fading between a reddish hue, a white hue, and a somewhat blue hue. we thought it might be some electrical weather phenomena in the sky. we also thought perhaps it was a medical helicopter or something; however, both the vicinity of where the lights were and the unusual patterns they were making (slow dimming and reappearing) made us question this a bit. also we heard no noise in the vicinity of the lights. we could not see an object due to cloud cover but the lights would fade in and out between levels of very dim to a high luminosity and tended to be in red and white mostly, and occasionally blue. they flashed first for about a minute and then disappeared completely (about 4 minutes). then, they reappeared (but quite a bit further away) and flashed for about another minute. at the second flashing they looked to be higher in altitude than the first flashing. after that they just totally vanished. we also looked to see if anything from the ground may be projecting them, but could not make any visual connections. we looked on in curiosity for a while. the objects didn't fade from view, they just completed stopped glowing with no sign of them after that. we checked the news reports but no accidents were reported. hanscom airport base is vaguely in the direction the lights were, although it is quite a way off. we were interested in possible natural phenomenas that might also cause these night lights at such an unusual latitude\longitude (ma)?
Summary: Unusual Lights in Sky over Stow/Sudbury line seen from Hudson MA
